attributes.action: the locals pictures on the wall in the Eyston Arms in East Hendred
attributes.additional_details:
The Eyston Arms is a poplular and historic local pub in the village of East Hendred in Oxfordshire. For many years drawings of local customers have been placed on the walls which has created a historical record of the many unquie characters of the village.
The current owners have now decided to remove these drawings thus totally removing the charm and uniquness of this historical records.
I would like this discussed by the government and, if possible, some kind of preservation order placed on this unique pictorial record.

rejection.details: Something to discuss with your local council, or perhaps contact English Heritage?
